roleset.name: unfill, empty
roleset.note: DRAIN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'drain' based on wsj; adjectival 'drained' based on BOLT-4,5. Comparison with 'fill'. Member of VNcls cheat-10.6-1, clear-10.3-1,other_cos-45.4. (from drain.01-v)
DRAINED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from drained.01-j)

example.name: all args, arg1 as PP
example.text: Fed funds is the rate banks charge each other on overnight loans; [the Fed]-1 influences the rate by *trace*-1 adding or draining reserves from the banking system.

example.name: all args, arg2 as PP
example.text: John drained the basement of floodwater.

example.name: oddly ergative
example.text: The clutter of the 1940s remains, but its color has drained away, and the will to overcome has been defeated.

example.name: just container
example.text: A lengthy recession, if it materializes, would drain state coffers and create severe hardships for urban workers.

example.name: careful!
example.text: While the government drains Pemex from above, the union has drained it from below.

example.name: Adjectival rel: drained
example.text: I m so emotionally drained and do nt want any friends to know because they 'll just think bad of him , when really he is good deep down .

example.name: All args
example.text: His draining the pasta [of water] ended in disaster, with steam burns on his forearms and tortellini all over the parquet.
